Articles.Content:
Basically, in this game everyone gets to decide what the rules are. Not through democracy or anything silly like that, but through plain disorganised rule chaos.

How does this work without descending into a meaningless thread? What happens is Player A posts an action, a statement, or whatever that they do. The next player states in their post whether or not that is allowed, then posts their action or statement. If something was allowed once, it is always allowed until someone is allowed to say that is not allowed. The first person to 100 points wins.

Example Gameplay

A: I grant myself one point.

B: That is not allowed. I grant myself one point through posting this image.

C: That is allowed. I grant myself one point.

D: That is not allowed. I grant myself one point through posting this image.

A: That is allowed.

And so on. Feel free to create complex webs of precedents in order to lead people to be forced to let you grant yourself 100 points. With my uncreative example done, I now start.

I grant myself one point.

Disallowed. Points can only be self-awarded in multiples of two.

I earn one bonus point for rectifying a rule violation (this does not count as a self-awarded point).
That is not allowed. I grant myself 2 point through correcting a corrected rule violation.

That is not allowed; correcting a rule violation may only grant a maximum of 1 point.

I grant myself one point for every user who has failed to pass a rule: +3 points.
That is allowed. I earn 2 points.

mythbusters844's comment is allowed.

Adding a rule that if anything is written in purple, player/user gains 5 points.

That is acceptable, but you must use perfect grammar whenever using purple text.

I gain four points, one for each rule violation before this post, leaving me with a total of six.

That is not acceptable. No player may have a total of six points at any time.

I gain six points for preventing the event of someone having a total of six points, leaving me with a total of 9.

That is allowed.

I gain five points, for I am writing in purple.

That is not allowed; the five-point for colour writing must change target colours on a daily basis. Today's colour is Red.

I gain five points for using the Colour of the Day, and presently have 14 points.
That is allowed. I also gain five points for using the daily colour of red.
This is indeed allowed. However, seeing as I am the twelfth poster, I gain 12 points for a total of 12.

That is not allowed. The number 12 only grants 6 points.

I gain 7 points. I automatically gain 5 points for using the daily colour, and award myself three points (one for notifying the law of a rule break, and two for making this post be acceptable by Rule No. 7's standards)

Points: 7

I get a point for every 4 posts the person who posts below me has. (please be a 400+ posts person !!!)

That is not allowed. I gain three points for preventing an instant-win situation. Henceforth, all players who do not publicly declare their running total immediately lose four points.

Points: 22. (+5 points for red, +3 for preventing instant win, previous total=14)
